questions.question_text: Without a Risk Register how can project risks, the progress of risk actions taken to date and the current status of residual risks be measured?

discussion.content: C. In a simple project, the Project Initiation Documentation (PID) should contain a register for recording risk information and monitoring project risks throughout the delivery stages. The register will now be added to the PID.

choices.C: In a simple project, the Project Initiation Documentation (PID) should contain a register for recording risk information and monitoring project risks throughout the delivery stages. The register will now be added to the PID.
choices.B: It was not appropriate to use the Daily Log to capture all risks and issues during the Starting up a Project process. Separate registers should have been set up for risks, issues and lessons learned. This will now be done.
choices.A: The Daily Log was correctly used to monitor risks during the Starting up a Project process. It will be used to capture all risks, actions, decisions, assumptions

choices.C: Amend entry 1 to read 'This document contains the means and frequency of communication between the project management team, the print company and other external parties.
choices.B: Amend entry 1 to read 'This document contains the controls and reporting to be established for the project management team'.
choices.A: No change to entry 1 because this shows the purpose and content of this document.

questions.question_text:
This question provides a number of changes which may or may not be required to the Extract from the Communication Management Strategy provided in the additional information.
Which statement applies to the Introduction section?

comments.content: Option C does not address the controls and reporting aspects, which are important components of a Communication Management Strategy. Therefore, Option B is the better choice as it aligns with the purpose and content of the document.

discussion.content:
Based on the current web page context, the correct answer is B. Amend entry 1 to read ‘This document contains the controls and reporting to be established for the project management team’.

The reason is that the Communication Management Strategy is a functional strategy that provides focus and direction to the corporate communication function. It should include communication procedures, tools and techniques, records, reporting, timings, roles and responsibilities and analysis. The original entry 1 is too vague and does not reflect the content of the document. The proposed amendment B clarifies the purpose and scope of the document. The amendment C is incorrect because it does not mention the controls and reporting aspects of the strategy.

questions.question_text: Which product should show that the photos could be used for other promotional material for the company?

comments.content:
Sorry, A. The answer is A. Benefits Review Plan.

According to PRINCE2, the Benefits Review Plan is a document that describes how and when the benefits of the project will be measured and reviewed1. It also identifies any benefits that can be realized after the project is closed1. Therefore, if the project is closed prematurely, the Benefits Review Plan should show that the photos could be used for other promotional material for the company, as this could be a potential benefit that can be achieved after the project closure. This would also help to justify the investment made in the project and reduce the loss of value.

discussion.content:
B

The Lessons Log is the proper document to record the fact that the photos taken for this project could be used for other promotional materials in the future. The key details are:

The End Project Report summarizes the project performance and benefits realized, but does not focus on assets after closure.
The Lessons Log documents lessons learned during the project, including things that went well and assets that could provide value in the future.
In this case, the unused photos are an asset that could benefit future projects.
Therefore, the Lessons Log is the correct artifact to note that the photos could be used for other company promotions.

Also 15.4.5 states "review the lessons log and agree lessons to include in the report. Ensure that the appropriate groups (e.g. corporate, programme management or the customer, or a centre of excellence) have been made aware of their responsibility for taking any recommendations forward".

I incorrectly thought lessons log at first, but 4.3.4.1 states "At the end of that management stage (and hence the project), an end project report was produced which also included the information for a lessons report, follow-on action recommendations and a benefits management approach."
I think A is the correct answer. The fact that a Benefit can still be realized ( after the closure of the project) should go into the Benefits Management approach

questions.question_text: Which product should show that the staff photo sessions were disruptive to the Engineering Department as they had been scheduled during peak work times without consultation with the Engineering Manager?

discussion.content:
While the other options could potentially reference this issue, the Lessons Report is the document purpose-built to record this type of lesson learned for future improvement.

Therefore, B is the correct choice to document that the staff photo sessions were disruptive to Engineering because of suboptimal scheduling without input from the Engineering Manager. The details should be captured in the Lessons Report to inform scheduling on future projects.

questions.question_text: Which product should show that if anybody has any remaining resource costs to be charged to the project, they should ensure this is done by 10 November?

discussion.content: option D is the correct choice, as the Project closure notification should include instructions for charging any remaining resource costs before the given deadline of 10 November
